definition: to get angry
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
spleen
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: There are few men in this world who get mad at graceful women.
sentences.chinese: 這個世上恐怕很少有男人會對閒雅的女人發脾氣。

sentences.english: He immediately got angry and squawked at her.
sentences.chinese: 公鵪鶉立刻大發脾氣並朝母鵪鶉大叫起來。

sentences.english: The child was furious and flung itself about the room .
sentences.chinese: 那小孩子大發脾氣，在房間裏衝來衝去。

sentences.english: We don't sulk, like a child.
sentences.chinese: 我們不像孩子那樣發脾氣。

sentences.english: You must bear with his bad temper; he has recently been ill.
sentences.chinese: 他最近生病，發脾氣時你要忍耐忍耐。

sentences.english: Mary flared up  when Jim angered her.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆把瑪麗惹怒了，於是她大發脾氣。

sentences.english: That girl stamps her foot when she is in a passion.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩一發脾氣就跺腳。

sentences.english: He will be nasty if you disobey him.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不服從他，他就會發脾氣。

sentences.english: Was he vexed at my bad humour this afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 我都忘啦，他是怪我今天下午發脾氣嗎？

sentences.english: Tariel : When was the last time when you really lost your temper on court ?
sentences.chinese: 你上次在球場上發脾氣是什麼時候？

sentences.english: When the tourist suddenly lost his temper, Wang became upset for being yelled at.
sentences.chinese: 當遊客突然大發脾氣，大喊大叫時，王琳感到很沮喪。

sentences.english: He discovered it was easier to holdhis temper than to drive those nails into the fence.
sentences.chinese: 男孩發現剋制自己不發脾氣比把釘子釘入柵欄內容易。

sentences.english: Speak calmly if you think you're in the right; there's no need to get angry.
sentences.chinese: 有理慢慢兒說，何必發脾氣。

sentences.english: Rona have a fit at the clothing store last Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 羅娜上星期天在服裝店大發脾氣。

sentences.english: I've forgotten. Was he vexed at my bad humour this afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 我都忘啦，他是怪我今天下午發脾氣嗎？

sentences.english: The boy discovered that it was easier to keep his temper than to drive the nails into the fence.
sentences.chinese: 那個孩子發現不發脾氣比往籬笆上釘釘子更容易。

definition: to get angry/to take offense/angry/vitality/liveliness
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
character/temperament/disposition/bad temper/CL:個|个[ge4]
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
this kind of/so/this way/like this/such
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
to scold/to abuse/to curse/CL:通[tong4],頓|顿[dun4]
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
emotional/sentimental
to drift apart/to become estranged/to alienate/estrangement
